intro: Asteriscium novarae, commonly known as the Novara asterisk, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant produces showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Asteriscium novarae is considered a vulnerable species.
